title: Matching Markets with Chores
authors: Jugal Garg, Thorben Tr\"obst, Vijay V. Vazirani
abstract:
The fair division of chores, as well as mixed manna (goods and chores), has
received substantial recent attention in the fair division literature; however,
ours is the first paper to extend this research to matching markets. Indeed,
our contention is that matching markets are a natural setting for this purpose,
since the manna that fit into the limited number of hours available in a day
can be viewed as one unit of allocation. We extend several well-known results
that hold for goods to the settings of chores and mixed manna. In addition, we
show that the natural notion of an earnings-based equilibrium, which is more
natural in the case of all chores, is equivalent to the pricing-based
equilibrium given by Hylland and Zeckhauser for the case of goods.
subjects: Computer Science/Computer Science and Game Theory
